description: Non-Windows path logs before logging is imported, causing NameError during import.
Non-Windows TTS path references tts_helper/check_espeak/linux_tts without import or definition, so calling this path crashes.
If http_get fails, response is undefined but is still accessed, breaking the background cycle thread.
When show_link is false, link_label is never created but display_flash and restore_colors still use it, causing NameError on flash.
update_display requires summary_var, but summary_var is never initialized, so updates are skipped.
If show_scroller is false, scrolling_summary is never defined but update_display still reads it, causing NameError.
In mode 1, current_title/current_summary/current_link/warning_* are assigned without global, so global state is not updated and UI/web can show stale data.
In mode 0, current_* are assigned without global, so global state is not updated and UI/web can show stale data.
warning_title/warning_summary can be unset if no Warnings and Watches entry exists but are used for UI/TTS unconditionally.
refresh_weather can create a new background cycle each time in mode 0, leading to thread leaks and duplicate updates.
start_webserver runs at import time, causing side effects (thread, port binding) that make imports harder to test or reuse.
SocketIO is configured but the server is started with app.run rather than socketio.run, so socketio.emit may not work as expected.
logger reads timestamp_var even when the GUI is not running; refresh_weather can be called without display and crash.
Config.get_config_port is called twice at startup, causing redundant file reads.
flash_delay is loaded but never used.
Weather fetch error is logged without exception details, which makes debugging harder.
Some globals like current_entry and summary_var appear unused or stale, increasing confusion.
